pdgm.pdgmnote: Amha2001 Table 4.2. PossType:poss1 – basic;poss2 – when possessed noun is modified;possNom1 – possessive noun involving known possession;possNom2 – possessive noun involving unknown possession
Amha2001 Table 5.1-2. Root structure:group1 – one-peak roots;group2 – two-peak roots

Amha2001 Ch. 7 (summary p. 158);Ch. 8 (summary p. 202). Maale verb morphology does not include subject agreement,with partial exception of imperative-optative. Inflectional template is:[VRoot (+ dervSuff)](+ AspectMarker) + moodClauseMarker. Attested combinations of aspect and clause suffixes given in paradigm.
Amha2001 #5.3.1.3 The various verbs BE/EXIST only occur with aspect suffixes noted in paradigm.

prop.val: with imperfPres even when situation refers to past event
ba- . . . Common : without aspect:bá-se does not exist

pdgm.pdgmnote: Amha2001 #5.2. Author gives many phonological and semantic details about affix and verb-stem alternations and lexico-semantic effects.

prop.val: -is- ~ -iš- ~ -z- ~ -s- ~ cc- goes_to cc- ~ šk- goes_to šš- / šk-is-

pdgm.pdgmnote: Amha2001 Table 4.1. 3Ref,called logophoric third person – 3LOGby Amha2001,is unmarked for case,num,and gen. This pronoun occurs only when there is a co-referential third person subject in the same sentence. It cannot e used co-referentially across sentences(p. 87).
